title: ICT-Integrated Mathematics Education Design for Engineering Managers in Large-Scale Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Core mathematical knowledge in engineering (linear algebra, calculus, etc.)
context.additional_context: Advanced professionals in managerial/leadership roles within enterprises, focusing on strengthening competencies to apply mathematical theories for practical problem-solving, requiring content optimized for smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can perform mathematical modeling of engineering problems with over 90% participation using activity theory-based ICT tools.
In a blended learning environment, learners can increase interaction frequency with peers by over 50% using smartphone-based collaboration tools (e.g., discussion boards, quiz apps).

Learners can develop and present three or more practical applications of mathematical theories through ICT-integrated learning activities (e.g., competitive response, thematic discussions, outcome sharing).

resources: Cloud-Based Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
